intro: Lastreopsis efulensis, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a distinct aroma when crushed. The fruit is a small, dry schizocarp that splits into two parts when mature.
